entry.title: Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management in SAP Cloud ERP 2602
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP's ready-to-run public cloud ERP software solution.  

SAP Cloud ERP is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data, and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the Cloud ERP ecosystem‚Äìcustomers, partners, and SAP experts.  

 

In this blog post I‚Äôd like to outline the innovations for SAP Cloud ERP 2602 in the area of Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management. These are the topics that are covered:

  • Enhanced integration of project plan information with SAP Cloud ERP (6JN) 
  • Project staffing view for resource managers (6JO) 
  • Allowing contingent workers (cost center procured) to record time on enterprise projects (1NT, 1Q4) 
  • Automatic removal of billing block for sales order billing plans (1NT) 
  • Joule as project assistant (beta), planned to be available mid-March
  • Further innovations

 

Check out my video to get a glimpse of the new features:

 

In today's fast-paced business environment, running projects efficiently, on time, and on budget is more critical than ever. This release is packed with features designed to bring more intelligence, automation, and transparency to your projects, ultimately driving significant business value. We‚Äôve focused on streamlining processes, enhancing integration, and even giving you a glimpse into the future with AI-powered assistance.

Let's dive into the highlights that will help you unlock new levels of project success.

 

Enhancements in SAP Project and Resource Management

 

Enhanced integration of project plan information with SAP Cloud ERP

In complex projects spanning engineering, manufacturing, and services, a major challenge is keeping project execution plans in sync with core financial and logistical data. A delay in a design phase, for example, has a direct impact on procurement timelines and billing dates. If this information isn't shared instantly between the project planning tool and the core ERP, decisions are made based on outdated information. To solve this, our 2602 release supercharges the integration between SAP Project and Resource Management, our solution on the SAP Business Technology Platform, and SAP Cloud ERP. Now, when a project manager adjusts a project plan ‚Äì such as extending a phase ‚Äì the system automatically synchronizes these date changes with the core ERP in real time.

This direct synchronization ensures that your financial, commercial, and logistical data within SAP Cloud ERP always reflects the most current project reality, empowering you to make reliable decisions based on a single source of truth. By automating the update process, you eliminate the need for project teams to manually replicate date changes across systems, which significantly reduces administrative effort and minimizes the risk of human error. This tight integration also lays the groundwork for faster billing cycles, as milestone completions in the project plan can now directly trigger commercial processes in the core system.

 

Figure 1: Improved integration of project plan information between SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Project and Resource Management, enables better decision-making in projects through reliable, up-to-date project plan information.

 

Project staffing view for resource managers

Resource managers are constantly juggling demands from multiple projects, and gaining a clear, consolidated overview of the staffing situation for a specific project can be a fragmented and time-consuming process. To address this pain point, we are introducing a brand-new SAP Fiori app called ‚ÄúManage Request Assignments‚Äù. This powerful application is designed specifically for resource managers, providing a single, project-centric view of all resource requests. It shows at a glance which roles have been fully staffed, which are partially staffed, and which are still open, eliminating the need to dig through multiple screens and reports.

This new application provides resource managers with unprecedented transparency into the staffing health of any project, allowing them to instantly identify bottlenecks and open demands without extensive research. Having all the necessary information in one place, with direct navigation to take action, streamlines the workflow and dramatically reduces the time it takes to staff open requests and get the right people on the right tasks. Ultimately, a clear, holistic overview empowers resource managers to more effectively optimize staffing within a single project or re-allocate experts across multiple projects, ensuring your most valuable resources are deployed with maximum impact.

 

Figure 2: The ‚ÄúManage Request Assignments‚Äù application allows users to efficiently view the resource request and assignment details at a project level.

 

Other Innovations in SAP Project and Resource Management

Additional enhancements introduced in SAP Project and Resource Management. For example:

  • Technical user flow coverage (client credential flow) for some APIs
  • Use of actual dates in scheduling
  • Consideration of working and none working days in scheduling
  • Ability to block certain file types during file upload
  • Additional details for tasks and collaboration project

For a complete list and more details please take a look into the What's new document for SAP Project and Resource Management

 

 

Enhancements in Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management

 

Allowing contingent workers (cost center procured) to record time on enterprise projects

Modern project teams are a dynamic blend of internal employees and external contingent workers. A significant process gap existed for contingent workers who were procured via a cost center, as they couldn't use the standard ‚ÄúMy Timesheet‚Äù application to record time against enterprise projects. This made it difficult to get a complete and timely picture of all labor hours and costs. With the 2602 release, we have closed this gap. Now, these contingent workers can use the very same ‚ÄúMy Timesheet‚Äù application as internal employees to record their time against the projects they are staffed on, creating a unified experience for the entire team.

This enhancement delivers a unified and simplified process where all project resources, regardless of their employment type, use a single application for time recording, which improves the user experience. You can now capture every hour worked against your project demands in one central place, providing a more accurate and timely view of total project costs and progress. Furthermore, the system automates the creation of the corresponding service entry sheet and goods receipt upon timesheet approval, significantly reducing administrative overhead and ensuring your suppliers are paid accurately and on time.

Figure 3: Project-based and cost center-based contingent workers can record time seamlessly in the ‚ÄúManage My Timesheet‚Äù application, ensuring consistent tracking and better visibility across all engagement types.

 

Automatic removal of billing block for sales order billing plans

Milestone billing is a fantastic way to align payments with project progress, but it has often been hampered by a manual step. Once a milestone was achieved, someone had to go into the sales order and manually remove the billing block to make that item available for invoicing, a delay that directly impacts cash flow. We have now fully automated this process. Building on a feature from our last release, the system now automatically removes the billing block from the corresponding billing plan item in the related sales order the moment a project manager confirms the completion of that milestone in the project.

By completely automating this process, you eliminate the manual hand-off and inherent delays, allowing you to invoice your customers the very moment a milestone is contractually met. This directly accelerates your order-to-cash cycle and improves cash flow. This automation also removes a tedious and error-prone manual task, freeing up your project controllers and sales administrators to focus their expertise on more strategic, value-added activities. The risk of human error is entirely eliminated, leading to a smoother, more reliable, and more accurate billing process from end to end.

 

Figure 4: For sales order billing plan items which are created based on enterprise project or WBS element milestones, the billing block is automatically removed when the related milestone is completed.

 

Joule as project assistant (beta), planned to be available mid-March

Setting up a new project can be a complex and time-consuming task, often requiring project managers to navigate between three or four different applications to define the scope, staff resources, and release the project for time recording. We are incredibly excited to give you a preview of how we are solving this with the future of project management: the Joule Project Assistant. This is our generative AI copilot, and we are starting with a beta agent designed to radically simplify the creation of internal projects. Instead of clicking through multiple screens, a project manager can simply ask Joule in natural language, e.g. "Create a new pre-sales project for the 'Rising Star' initiative, starting next week and lasting for one month.". Joule can then propose a template, adjust dates, staff the project, and release it ‚Äì all within a single, conversational session.

This AI-powered assistant promises dramatic efficiency gains, condensing a multi-application process into a single, swift conversation that saves significant time and effort for your project managers. The intuitive, conversational nature of Joule makes project creation accessible to everyone, drastically reducing the learning curve and empowering users to initiate projects quickly and correctly. By leveraging templates from successful past projects, the Joule agent also helps ensure that new projects are set up consistently and in compliance with your company's standards right from the start. We are currently running a beta program for this and encourage you to get involved! Register for the Customer Engagement Initiative via this landing page as of March 15, 2026.

 

Figure 5: The AI-powered solution assists users in rapidly setting up projects by leveraging similar past projects when the volume is high, and projects are repetitive in nature.



Other innovations in Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management

We know how critical it is to have a clear, unified view of project financials. That's why we‚Äôve introduced the company code currency into the Project Cost report. Now, you can see a consolidated view of all your key cost figures including planned costs, actuals, commitments, and even project stock costs ‚Äì all in a single, consistent currency. This provides a much clearer picture of your project's overall financial health and variance.

There is one important prerequisite to keep in mind: for the report to display in the company code currency, all the projects and WBS elements you select for that report must share the same company code. This ensures data integrity and accurate reporting. For a more detailed guide on this feature, I encourage you to check out the documentation on the SAP Help Portal.

Second, we‚Äôve Improved system usability by segregating the profitability segment from settlement rules for clearer allocation and analysis. What does this mean for you? In the past, assigning profitability might have required you to set up a settlement rule. Now, for projects with revenue, you can assign the profitability segment directly to a billing WBS element using the "Assign" function. This is a much more direct and intuitive workflow. It saves you steps, simplifies the allocation process, and makes your analysis clearer and more efficient. As with all our features, you can find comprehensive details on this enhancement in the SAP Help Portal.

Finally, and this is something I‚Äôm personally very excited about, we are going beyond system features to build a stronger community. We are officially introducing the new CIP community ‚Äì a collaborative space designed for our customers, partners, and SAP experts to connect. The goal is to build a powerful network where we can all share ideas, discuss best practices, and co-innovate on the future of enterprise and collaborative project scenarios. This is your platform to influence the direction of our products and learn from your peers.

If you are interested in joining this community and helping shape the future of project management at SAP, please reach out to my colleagues, Anke Junker anke.junker@sap.com or Varsha Chetan Manu varsha.chetan.manu@sap.com, to get involved.


The SAP Cloud ERP 2602 release for EPPM is all about making your project management more connected, automated, and intelligent. From ensuring a single source of truth to simplifying daily tasks for every project role, these innovations are designed to deliver tangible business value and set you up for success.

Thank you for your time, and I look forward to seeing how you leverage these new capabilities.

 

 

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the replays of our SAP Cloud ERP 2602 Early Release Series!

From January 12-16, we hosted a series of 22 expert-led live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP Cloud ERP 2602 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you. You will find the recording and presentation for Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management as well as 21 other topics of interest. Don't miss this chance and watch them on demand ‚Äì anywhere, anytime.

entry.title: SAP Portugal ATCUD: Preparing for the 2026 SAF-T Tables Deprecation
entry.content:
The Evolution of Compliance

SAF-T (and similar frameworks) has evolved significantly from being a simple audit file into a complex legal requirement affecting local usage. In Portugal, the introduction of ATCUD fundamentally changed how document series and number ranges must be defined and validated, creating a ripple effect across many SAP customizations.

When ATCUD was first implemented, it enforced stricter rules regarding document series and numbering. To bridge the gap between older implementations and these new local requirements, SAP introduced specific tables and exception mechanisms as interim workarounds. While these measures helped customers adapt at the time, they created parallel sources of truth for document definitions, making governance, compliance, and testing significantly harder.

The Technical Shift: What is Changing?

After nearly three years of live ATCUD operations, SAP is moving to "tidy up" the system by deprecating three legacy tables used in the past to provide as workaround to derive the same information.

Planned for deprecation in 2026 are:

  • FIEU_MFI Map Document Type to Invoice Type (FI Invoice): A legacy table used to hold mappings or exceptions for FI documents tied to SAF-T/ATCUD rules, often containing localized mappings that bypassed standard numbering rules.
  • FIPTC_DOC_EXC Define Number Ranges for Internal Documents: A table used to store document exceptions and special handling for print, output, and validation workflows, frequently utilized for legacy processes or third-party add-ons.
  • FIEUD_SDGEN: Map Sales Category to Invoice Type: A table where you define sales document categories that are not available by default. The corresponding invoice type is then inserted in the XML file.

Once these tables are deprecated, the only official customization sources for defining documents will be SIPT_NUMBR_FI_V2 (for Financial Accounting) and SIPT_NUMBR_SD_V2 (for Sales and Distribution) ... and don‚Äôt forget the series validation framework (transaction code: GLO_PT_SVC)

NOTE: These tables will remain available; however, they will no longer be relevant for SAF‚ÄëT reporting from 2026 onward.

Why This Consolidation Matters The primary goal of this deprecation is to remove redundancy and force a single authoritative configuration for series and number ranges that aligns with legal ATCUD requirements. Consolidating document definition into the SIPT_NUMBR_* tables offer several benefits:

  • Consistency: It reduces the chance of two subsystems defining the same document differently.
  • Simplified Audits: It eliminates the complexity of checking multiple control points.
  • Governance: It removes the risk of "less-informed users" relying on legacy settings that cause inconsistencies.

Conclusion Start your discovery phase now by running an impact assessment for the legacy tables and mapping every dependency. Engaging your implementation partner early allows for proper planning and testing, ensuring the migration goes smoothly well before the 2026 deadline.

For more information, check SAP note 3688051 and SAFT collective note 1981139

Solution for Public Cloud to be available soon

Hope you enjoyed this information. Don't forget to leave your comments. 

Elsa

entry.title: Re: Ehanced limits for PO is not applicable for invoices
entry.content:
Dear @jerrysam,

Yes in Public Cloud you can control this. What you are seeing posting invoices far above the Enhanced Limit Overall Limit typically happens when the invoice tolerance check for limit items is not configured or the message is configured only as a warning

For Enhanced Limit PO items (item category E), SAP uses specific Logistics Invoice Verification (LIV) tolerance keys and message control:

  • Tolerance key LA = checks whether the invoice exceeds the overall limit of the limit/enhanced-limit item (message M8298)
  • Additionally, if you use performance periods and invoice directly against the PO (without SES/GR), tolerance key LD may be relevant (message M8297)

To make it an error (hard stop) at posting, you must do both:

  1. maintain the tolerance limit and
  2. set the message severity to Error

SAP Note below:

https://me.sap.com/notes/0002841906

Steps to do:

1. Maintain the tolerance limit for LA:

In CBC go to 101947 Set Tolerance Limits

Create/maintain an entry for your Company Code with tolerance key:

  • LA (PO limit amount exceeded)

Set the upper limits so that any exceed over the overall limit is rejected. This meaning, the system should not accept exceeding the overall limit at all

More details in SAP Note below:

https://me.sap.com/notes/0003052672

2. Set message M8298 to Error not Warning

Search for 102091 Define Message Types for Area M8 and set:

  • Message: M8 298 ->Type = Error

 

This is the step that turns the tolerance violation into a hard posting error instead of a warning

3. Important process note (SES / GR indicator)

If your process is Lean Services with Service Entry Sheets:

  • When the PO item has Goods Receipt indicator set, SAP expects the SES to be the controlling document and some checks happen at SES time, not only at invoice time
  • If you allow invoices directly against the PO (no SES required) then the invoice tolerance setup above becomes even more critical

SAP Note below:

https://me.sap.com/notes/0002841906

4. Quick test

  1. Create an Enhanced Limit PO with Overall Limit = 5,000 EUR
  2. Create supplier invoice with reference to that PO for 6,000 EUR
  3. Expected result after the setup: Posting is blocked with an error

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: MTO Process - MRP live
entry.content:
Hi all,

we are introducing ePP/DS. 

There is a scenario where we need to have MTO on a distribution center, where products are usually procurement type F. We need the products to be first created uncovertible in a customer segement. The requirement is to plan in advance and to propagate demand to the manufacturing site and then to let SBC create the convertible STR once a Sales order is created.

Unfortunately this is not possible with ePPDS. ePPDS cannot create planned orders for procurment type F which are moved to an uncovertible segment.

The process  works perfectly fine with classic MRP. But classic MRP is about to be phased out of support. Therefore we try to build the solution based on MRP live and ePPDS. 

We have tested MRP live, and it successfully creates planned orders for procurement type F materials. However, there is an SAP note that raises some concerns, stating that MRP live cannot create planned orders for materials with this procurement type. I would like to clarify whether this functionality will remain available in MRP live, as the behavior seems to contradict what is mentioned in the note.

 

Maybe someone from SAP can comment as the the behavior is contradicting the message in the note.

entry.title: How to enable BC Set support for BC app
entry.content:
Introduction

In order to use the "import from transport" function in the BC Set editor, the data must be recorded in the context of a transport object (TOBJ) and the business configuration maintenance object (SMBC) must maintain the corresponding transport object attribute.

This blog explains the necessary steps to enable existing SMBC objects for the "import from transport" functionality. Newly generated SMBC objects are automatically enabled.

This blog is relevant for

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP BTP ABAP environment

Further reading:

  • Related blog posts
  • Learn how you can use ABAP technology to develop innovative applications and business solutions across SAP‚Äôs portfolio on SAP Learning Site.

Case 1: Transport object is already used in the BC app

As of release 2302, when you use the ADT wizard to generate a business configuration maintenance object (SMBC), a transport object (TOBJ) is generated by default and used in the behavior implementation. In this case you only need to maintain the new "Transport Object" attribute of the SMBC object.

You can do this manually in the ADT editor of the SMBC object or programmatically. First you need to find out the name of the transport object. In most cases the name is equal to the name of the SMBC object. You can open the behavior implementation class and check the first couple of rows to verify the name of the transport object ( depending on the release the object was created: CO_TRANSPORT_OBJECT or TDAT_NAME )

CLASS LHC_COMPANYCODEALL DEFINITION FINAL INHERITING FROM CL_ABAP_BEHAVIOR_HANDLER.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CONSTANTS:
      CO_ENTITY TYPE abp_entity_name VALUE `ZI_COMPANYCODE_S`,
      CO_TRANSPORT_OBJECT TYPE mbc_cp_api=>indiv_transaction_obj_name VALUE `ZCOMPANYCODE`,
      CO_AUTHORIZATION_ENTITY TYPE abp_entity_name VALUE `ZI_COMPANYCODE`.
CLASS LHC_RAP_TDAT_CTS DEFINITION FINAL.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    CLASS-METHODS:
      GET
        RETURNING
          VALUE(RESULT) TYPE REF TO IF_MBC_CP_RAP_TDAT_CTS.

ENDCLASS.

CLASS LHC_RAP_TDAT_CTS IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD GET.
    result = mbc_cp_api=>rap_tdat_cts( tdat_name = 'ZTAB6'

You can maintain the attribute "Transport Object" in the "Service Configuration" section of the SMBC object in the ADT editor. Save and activate.

You can update this attribute also programmatically:

CLASS zset_tobj DEFINITION
  PUBLIC
  FINAL
  CREATE PUBLIC .

  PUBLIC SECTION.
    INTERFACES if_oo_adt_classrun .
  PROTECTED SECTION.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS zset_tobj IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD if_oo_adt_classrun~main.
    DATA smbc_id TYPE TABLE OF if_mbc_cp_api_business_config=>ty_technical_id WITH EMPTY KEY.
    SELECT ABAPObject FROM I_CustABAPObjDirectoryEntry
      WHERE ABAPObjectType = 'SMBC' AND ABAPObject LIKE '<NAMESPACE>%'
      INTO TABLE @smbc_id .
    LOOP AT smbc_id ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<smbc_id>).
      out->write( |SMBC object: { <smbc_id> }| ).
      TRY.
          DATA(tobj) = mbc_cp_api=>business_configuration_api( <smbc_id> )->read( )-transport_object.
          IF tobj IS NOT INITIAL.
            out->write( |TOBJ already set: { tobj }| ).
          ELSE.
            mbc_cp_api=>business_configuration_api( <smbc_id> )->update_transport_object(
              transport_object = <smbc_id> "if the table list of the transport object does not match the table list of the behavior definition an exception is raised
              transport        = '<Workbench Request>' ). "transport=space for local objects
            out->write( |TOBJ set: { mbc_cp_api=>business_configuration_api( <smbc_id> )->read( )-transport_object }| ).
          ENDIF.
        CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(exc).
          out->write( |Error: { exc->get_text( ) }| ).
      ENDTRY.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

Use Case 2: The BC app does not use a transport object

Delete the existing BC app and create it again using the ADT wizard.

If you cannot do that, you can also use the ADT wizard to generate a new BC app for the table(s) with different object names. Move the generated transport object to the package of the old BC app and maintain the transport object attribute of the old SMBC object.
If necessary, adjust the generated TOBJ by changing the table piece list.
Adjust the old behavior implementation class by by replacing the existing method implementation with the equivalent method implementation of the new behavior implementation class. Adjust the constants to match the old object names.
You can now delete the newly generated objects.

entry.title: Re: Skills in SAP SuccessFactors: Field Guide for a Clean Build (TIH, JPB, CPM, OMP)
entry.content:
@Nadine2 

Hello Nadine,

Thanks for your kind words,

I would recommend to: 

1) Keep a clear ‚Äúsystem of record‚Äù split

  • People Profile / EC (Background elements): education, work experience, etc. = HR master/background record.

  • Growth Portfolio (TIH): attributes used for matching, recommendations, development, opportunity marketplace, etc.

This prevents the ‚Äúeverything becomes a custom attribute‚Äù trap.

2) Use TIH standard types where possible
SAP‚Äôs TIH guidance/learning materials show Competency, Skill, and Language as standard attribute types, with the option to create more custom types. So if Language is part of your skills-led matching, it‚Äôs reasonable to maintain it in TIH.

3) Use JPB custom attribute mapping only for role expectations
Use the new capability for things that are genuinely role requirements / role context, for example:

  • certifications, tools/technologies, domain knowledge

  • working styles, preferences, motivations (your examples are spot-on)

  • any ‚Äúmust-have / nice-to-have‚Äù capability signals

Thanks!

Nagesh Polu.

entry.title: Composable Storefront local setup and OAuth Framework Update JDK21
entry.content:
Introduction

Since SAP Commerce Cloud Framework Update JDK21, OAuth flow is totally different and more secure. We're not using anymore password authentication directly on OAuth stack.  In replacement, OAuth PKCE Flow is now used: https://oauth.net/2/pkce/

You can run the playground example if you want to familiarize yourself with : https://www.oauth.com/playground/authorization-code-with-pkce.html

Local setup

Domain checking is more strict. And default localhost should be forgotten. In our example, it is based on Spartacus Sample data from B2C Electronics WebShop.

In your Operating System, you need to declare an explicit domain name

vim /etc/hosts
127.0.0.1 electronics-spa.local

In your Composable Storefront app, you need to review NodeJs start up command line to include your domain name

package.json
"start": "ng serve --host electronics-spa.local",

 OCC API EndPoints need to be updated too

spartacus-configuration.module.ts
baseUrl: 'https://electronics-spa.local:9002',

SAP Commerce CORS rules need to be updated to allow Composable Storefront

corsfilter.default.allowedOrigins=http://electronics-spa.local:4200
corsfilter.commercewebservices.allowedOrigins=http://electronics-spa.local:4200
corsfilter.permissionswebservices.allowedOrigins=http://electronics-spa.local:4200
corsfilter.personalizationwebservices.allowedOrigins=http://electronics-spa.local:4200
corsfilter.acceleratorservices.allowedOrigins=http://electronics-spa.local:4200

And finally, you can import this following Impex to setup OAuth client parameters

# Public OAuth Client Credential
INSERT_UPDATE OAuthClientDetails; clientId[unique=true];public;authorities ;scope ;authorizedGrantTypes;registeredRedirectUri;loginPageUri   
;mobile_android_public;true;ROLE_CLIENT;basic;authorization_code,refresh_token ;http://electronics-spa.local:4200 ;/login

As you can notice, there's no password setup for this client. Authentication flow is using authorization code and SAP Commerce as IdP and login page host.

Testing

http://electronics-spa.local:4200/electronics-spa/en/USD/

When you click on Sign in, you should be redirected to SAP Commerce where login page is hosted

https://electronics-spa.local:9002/authorizationserver/login

After password validation by SAP Commerce, temporary code is generated and send back to SAP Composable Storefront. Then, this code is sent to OAuth layer for validation. And finally, user is redirected to Home Page.

http://electronics-spa.local:4200/?code=BD4mlnvjBnnpkfPP2wqC4Q0evvODFYObjPH8uGzYo-k4QcXn8TFnTs

http://electronics-spa.local:4200/electronics-spa/en/USD/

 

Conclusion

This article should help you to setup your local project and to understand behind the hood how OAuth flow work. If you need more assistance, please don't hesitation to contact direct SAP Expert Service team : sapcx-expertservices@sap.com

entry.title: Run your app on any UI5 version
entry.content:
Here‚Äôs a quick, zero-deploy way to test your app against a specific SAPUI5 version right from the browser.

The hack
- Append the UI5 version you want to your app URL:
- If your URL has no query parameters: ?sap-ui-version=1.43.2
- If it already has query parameters: &sap-ui-version=1.43.2
- Example: https://my-app.example.com/index.html?sap-ui-version=1.120.3

What it does
- When your app bootstraps SAPUI5 from the SAP CDN, adding sap-ui-version in the URL instructs UI5 to load its resources from that version.
- In practice, you can flip between versions to quickly check whether a bug is version-specific without touching your build or deployment pipeline.

How to confirm it worked
- Open the browser console and run:
- sap.ui.getVersionInfo().version
- You should see the version you specified in the URL.

Great use cases
- Reproducing customer issues on older UI5 versions
- Validating if a regression disappears on a newer patch
- Comparing behavior across minor versions without rebuilding

Important notes and caveats
- It works when your app loads UI5 from the SAPUI5/OpenUI5 CDN (e.g., ‚Ä¶/resources/sap-ui-core.js). If your app uses a self-hosted UI5 (e.g., from an ABAP front-end server), the parameter may not take effect.
- Some apps explicitly pin a version in the bootstrap URL (e.g., ‚Ä¶/1.108.3/resources/sap-ui-core.js). In that case, the pinned version will win.
- Browser caching and accelerators can get in the way. If the version doesn‚Äôt seem to change, hard refresh the page (Ctrl/Cmd+Shift+R) or clear cache.
- Don‚Äôt ship this as a ‚Äúfeature‚Äù for end users. It‚Äôs a developer convenience for testing and troubleshooting.
- Compatibility isn‚Äôt guaranteed across major/minor versions. Always validate critical flows when switching versions.

Bonus: other handy UI5 URL flags
- sap-ui-debug=true ‚Äî loads non-minified sources for better stack traces
- sap-ui-language=en ‚Äî forces a language for quick i18n checks
- sap-ui-theme=sap_fiori_3 ‚Äî switches theme without redeploy
- sap-ui-xx-componentPreload=off ‚Äî disables component preload during debugging

Wrap-up
Next time you need to answer ‚ÄúIs this a UI5 issue or my app?‚Äù save yourself a build and try the URL trick. A simple &sap-ui-version=‚Ä¶ can be the fastest path to clarity.

Thank you

entry.title: Unsere Strategie f√ºr die elektronische Rechnungsstellung f√ºr Lieferanten im SAP Business Network
entry.content:
Weltweit setzen Regierungen auf Digitalisierung, um Prozesse zu beschleunigen, Transparenz zu erh√∂hen und die Steuerkonformit√§t in der Rechnungsstellung sicherzustellen. F√ºr Unternehmen bedeutet das: Immer mehr L√§nder f√ºhren E‚ÄëRechnungen, stattliche Steuerportale und neue Regulierungsvorgaben ein. Die Rechnungsstellungslandschaft wandelt sich grundlegend ‚Äì und Compliance wird zum entscheidenden Faktor bei der Anbieterauswahl.

Was ist ein E-Invoicing-Mandat?

Jedes Land verf√ºgt √ºber eigene Vorschriften und setzt diese in seinen Digitalisierungs- und Steuer-Compliance-Prozessen unterschiedlich schnell um. Die elektronische Rechnungsstellung √ºber staatliche Portale ist in Brasilien seit fast zwei Jahrzehnten Standard. Europa durchl√§uft denselben Wandel: L√§nder wie Italien (SDI), Ungarn (NAV) und andere EU-Mitgliedstaaten machen den elektronischen Austausch  schrittweise zur Pflicht. 

E-Invoicing-Mandate umfassen verschiedene Anforderungen: Formatierungsstandards, Reporting  an Beh√∂rdenportale oder vollst√§ndig integrierte Rechnungsabwicklungssysteme. Dies macht die Rechnungsstellung insbesondere f√ºr international t√§tige Unternehmen komplexer. Unsere Kollege Christoph Neumann hat diese Szenarien in einem aktuellen Webcast er√∂rtert.

Herausforderungen f√ºr Unternehmen

Zur Erf√ºllung gesetzlicher Compliance-Vorgaben m√ºssen Unternehmen fortlaufend auf sich √§ndernde Regularien reagieren, den aktuellen Stand sicherstellen und sich in beh√∂rdliche Portale beziehungsweise staatliche Netzwerke integrieren. Dies f√ºhrt h√§ufig zu Redundanzen und macht bestehende E-Invoicing-L√∂sungen teilweise obsolet. F√ºr Lieferanten bedeutet dies, Bestellungen in einem Portal zu erhalten, Rechnungen jedoch im vorgeschriebenen Regierungsportal einzureichen. Dieser Medienbruch erzeugt Ineffizienzen und schm√§lert den Mehrwert bei der Nutzung von B2B Netzwerke wie dem SAP Business Network.

 

Unsere Strategie f√ºr die Zukunft

Im kontinuierlichen Dialog mit unseren Kunden haben wir eine klare Vision und Strategie entwickelt, die wir bereits in einem fr√ºheren Beitrag vorgestellt haben.

Das SAP Business Network geht √ºber reine Compliance hinaus: Ziel ist es, die unternehmens√ºbergreifende Zusammenarbeit zu optimieren und die Interaktion von Unternehmen mit Handelspartnern und Steuerbeh√∂rden weltweit mithilfe von SAP- und Partner-Anwendungen grundlegend zu modernisieren.

Zur Realisierung dieser Vision sind vier zentrale Innovationen geplant, die die Weiterentwicklung des SAP Business Network pr√§gen werden:

Erstens √∂ffnen wir das Netzwerk: Lieferanten erhalten einen Single Access Point f√ºr die Ausgangsrechnungen, um rechtskonforme E-Rechnungen sowohl innerhalb als auch au√üerhalb des SAP Business Network an ihre Kunden zu senden.

Zweitens erweitern wir die Bearbeitung von Rechnungs Disputes um integrierte, KI-gest√ºtzte Workflows, um manuellen Aufwand zu reduzieren und schnellere, nachvollziehbare L√∂sungen f√ºr K√§ufer und Lieferanten zu erm√∂glichen.

Drittens erh√∂hen wir die Transparenz des Rechnungsstatus durch pr√§zisere Ablehnungs- und Fehlercodes inklusive klarer Begr√ºndungen.

Viertens f√ºhren wir die regelbasierten Business-Rule-Pr√ºfungen f√ºr K√§ufer wieder ein, um Qualit√§t und Konformit√§t eingehender Rechnungen bereits beim Eingang sicherzustellen.

K√ºnftig werden Lieferanten das SAP Business Network als zentrale Plattform nutzen, um alle ihre K√§ufer zu erreichen ‚Äì mit der Gewissheit, dass l√§nderspezifische Anforderungen und komplexe Vorgaben zur Rechnungsstellung durchg√§ngig ber√ºcksichtigt sind. Weniger Kl√§rungsf√§lle, mehr Transparenz √ºber Fehler- und Ablehnungsgr√ºnde sowie eine durchg√§ngige, nahtlose E-Rechnungsstellung schaffen einen einheitlichen Kommunikationskanal zwischen Lieferanten und ihren Kunden.

 

SAP Business Network: Mehr als nur Compliance

F√ºr SAP ist Compliance nicht das Ziel, sondern die Grundlage. Wir verfolgen regulatorische Weiterentwicklungen im Steuer- und Rechnungswesen kontinuierlich und setzen sie konsequent um. Durch sorgf√§ltige Sorgfaltspr√ºfungen stellen wir die Einhaltung aller Vorgaben sicher. Unser Netzwerk ist daher bereits in M√§rkten rechtskonform, in denen die Nutzung staatlicher Portale verpflichtend ist oder besondere Anforderungen gelten.

Noch wichtiger: Das SAP Business Network schafft Mehrwert √ºber reine Gesetzeskonformit√§t hinaus. Lieferanten profitieren von flexiblen, intuitiven und robusten Funktionen, mit denen sie ihre Gesch√§ftsprozesse automatisieren, optimieren und skalieren k√∂nnen. Dazu z√§hlen unter anderem:

  • Ein flexibles Angebots- und Preismodell
  • Eine intuitive Benutzeroberfl√§che und ein effizienter PO-to-Invoice -Prozess
  • Transparenz √ºber den Rechnungsstatus und Echtzeitbenachrichtigungen f√ºr eine reibungslose Kundenkommunikation
  • Ein umfassendes Unternehmensprofil mit Compliance- und Nachhaltigkeitsinformationen
  • √ñffentliche und private elektronische Kataloge zur Vermarktung von Produkten und Services
  • Leistungsf√§hige Business-Intelligence-Funktionen und von der Community validierte Analysen zur Unterst√ºtzung strategischer Gespr√§che
  • Wachstumschancen durch erh√∂hte Sichtbarkeit bei neuen Einkaufsorganisationen

Mit diesen F√§higkeiten und unserem klaren strategischen Fokus sind wir √ºberzeugt, dass das Netzwerk die bevorzugte Plattform f√ºr Unternehmen bleibt, die √ºber einfache Transaktionen hinaus nachhaltigen, strategischen Mehrwert anstreben.

Weitere Details finden Sie in unserer E-Invoicing-Strategie.

Bleiben Sie dran! Folgen Sie uns, indem Sie den Tag "SAP Business Network for Suppliers‚Äú abonnieren. Klicken Sie einfach oben auf dieser Seite auf die blaue Schaltfl√§che.

entry.title: Re: Intercompany Invoice IDoc not posting gainst the orig...
entry.content:
No, the IDoc-based incoming intercompany supplier invoice does not post directly against the original PO in Public Cloud. The journal entry is intentionally not linked to the PO. So the implication is PO history will only reflect goods receipt and not invoice receipt in intercompany scenarios.

Workarounds are

  • Use reporting tools (e.g., Fiori apps for Intercompany Billing) to reconcile PO and invoice data.
  • For PO-linked invoice postings, manual supplier invoice posting (via "Create Supplier Invoice" app) is required.

Check this SAP document Configure Intercompany Billing Communication 

which confirms this automatic posting is financial-only. It creates the vendor liability but does not update the PO history or document flow in the receiving company code

entry.title: SuccessFactors Custom Portlet Notifications via CPI to Microsoft Teams
entry.content:
Detailed Problem Description / Question

I‚Äôm looking for guidance (or an SAP KBA reference) around sending notifications from SAP SuccessFactors to Microsoft Teams via SAP CPI, specifically when the source is a custom portlet.

In our scenario, we have a custom portlet in SuccessFactors that displays an alert or status message on the SuccessFactors home page. Unlike standard SuccessFactors Teams notifications, this custom portlet does not automatically trigger a Teams notification.

The requirement is as follows:

  • A notification or alert occurs in a custom SuccessFactors portlet

  • This event should be picked up by SAP CPI

  • CPI should then send a notification to a Microsoft Teams channel (webhook)

At this stage, we understand that:

  • SuccessFactors does not natively generate MS Teams notifications for custom portlets

  • Any notification would likely require custom integration logic (e.g. OData, Integration Center extract, or custom API trigger)

  • CPI would be responsible for transforming the message and forwarding it to Microsoft Teams

My questions are:

  1. Is there an official SAP KBA or documentation that confirms custom portlets do not support native notifications?

  2. Are there recommended or supported approaches for enabling CPI to detect an event or change from a custom portlet?

  3. Has anyone successfully implemented a CPI ‚Üí Microsoft Teams notification for a custom SuccessFactors object or portlet, and if so, what approach was used?

Best Regards

Adele Beets

entry.title: Re: To make Grouping field mandatory in Business Partner...
entry.content:
The Business Partner Grouping (BU_GROUP) field cannot be set as mandatory because it follows predefined system logic:

  • If no BP Grouping is chosen and no BP number is entered, the system automatically assigns the standard internal grouping.
  • If no BP Grouping is chosen but a BP number is manually entered, the system automatically assigns the standard external grouping

entry.title: Crystal Reports XI ‚Äì Print Setup does not allow printer selection (Delphi 7)Crystal Reports XI
entry.content:
I am using Crystal Reports XI (11) with Delphi 7 and the TCrpe component.
The Crystal runtime is correctly installed.

When I open the report preview using:

crpe1.Execute;


the preview window shows only three buttons:

Print ‚Üí sends the report directly to the Windows default printer

Print Setup ‚Üí allows only page settings (paper size, orientation, margins)

Export ‚Üí exports the report to a file

There is no option to select a printer in the preview or in the Print Setup dialog.

In Crystal Reports 8.5, the Print Setup dialog included printer selection, so the user could choose the printer after previewing the report.
In Crystal Reports XI, this option no longer exists.

Because of this change, the user is forced to select a printer before previewing (using crpe1.Printer.Prompt), even in cases where the user may only want to preview and not print at all.

This creates a poor user experience compared to version 8.5.

My questions are:

Why was printer selection removed from Print Setup in Crystal Reports XI?

Is there any supported way to enable printer selection after preview, like in version 8.5?

Or is this a hard limitation of Crystal Reports XI with no workaround?

Thank you.

entry.title: Integration Advisor ‚Äì Create 1:1 Mapping Elements in MAG Editor
entry.content:
In this blog post, I'd like to share with you a great new feature that we have recently delivered: in the Mapping Guideline (MAG) Editor, you can now use the Create 1:1 Mappings feature to automatically map the same nodes in the source and target subtrees.  

How to Use the New Feature

From the SAP Customer Influence program, we have learned that you, as our customers, frequently need the feature to create 1:1 mappings between identical message structures (see here for more details: Link). A typical use case for such a feature would be: you may need to do a few modifications to a message payload while keeping the rest unchanged. In such a case, you would need to define identical mappings for most of the message nodes and define a few diverging mapping elements for the required modifications. Our new feature helps to speed up the definition of the identical mapping elements.

In the header of the Mapping List section, you will find the new Create 1:1 Mappings button. To use it, you need to select group nodes on the source and target sides. To do so, either click first on the desired source node and then on the target node or draw a mapping line between the desired group nodes. Now, you can click on the Create 1:1 Mappings button to apply the new feature.

See the screenshot below for an illustration. In the example, we want to create identical mappings for the subtrees of Party[BUY] and Buyer.

The result of this action is shown in the following screenshot:

Mapping elements have been created for the identical nodes Name and Address, as well as for most child nodes of Address. Neither the source node partyRole nor the target node PartyID has a matching node and therefore no mappings have been created for them.  

In order to match source and target nodes, the following rules are applied:

  • Direct child nodes of the selected group nodes (like Name and Address) are matched if they have the same identifier and the same namespace prefix (if applicable). More precisely, they are matched if they have the same XML Node Name.
    • Note: In the MIG Editor, click on any node and navigate to the right-hand side to the tab Details, section Identifier Information. There, you will find the XML Node Name among other identifying information for the node. 
  • Matching also works if the nodes use the Integration Advisor qualifier concept (with the same qualifier values).
  • Moreover, matching is also applied to child nodes of child nodes (like Street or City). Here, the same rules as before are applied, but this requires that their parent node (here Address) has been matched as well.

And let me finally add a few more technical details:

  • The feature can be applied to complete message structures (by selecting both root nodes) but also to any other source and target group nodes (as in our example). In the latter case, group nodes do not need to have the same identifier.
  • New mapping elements are only created for previously unmapped target nodes. Existing mapping elements are not modified or removed. In our example above, a constant value had previously been defined for the target node AddressTypeCode, and this mapping remained unchanged (although there was a matching node on the source side).
  • The newly created mapping elements behave similarly to manually created mapping elements; in particular, Code Value Mapping or Date Time Conversion is automatically chosen if applicable. In our example above, the mapping element for CountryCode is a Code Value Mapping.

Conclusion

This blog post explains our new feature for creating 1:1 mappings in the MAG Editor. This feature will help you work even more efficiently with Integration Advisor when you need to automatically map complete message structures or subtrees.  

Further reading

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/working-with-mapping-guideline-mag 

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-sap/integration-advisor-overview-of-components-for-...

@RicardoRomero_1 

Hi Ricardo,

it's not Adobe-related but an issue introduced by a recent Windows update for Webview2 Version 144.xxx which causea the HTML control in SAP to no longer work properly in many places in SAP.

SAP has released a KBA which gets updated when there's any news about a fix:
3704912 - Latest Webview2 Version 144.xxx causes problems with SAP GUI HTML control when using edge as browser control in SAP GUI for Windows

A quick fix is to change the interactive design in the GUI-setting (version 800 is affected) to "Internet Explorer" for the time being. This may however cause other issues elsewhere because IE is no longer really supported.

Hope this helps!

Cheers

B√§rbel

entry.title: Re: Need BAdI for Auto-Setting Validity Date in Sales Enq...
entry.content:
Hello @Guna_M 

What you have described is good for sales functional object but for public cloud you need to consider a different approach. The public cloud does not permit the implementation of enhancements through SE18 or 19. Public cloud offers the use of Custom Logic with the released cloud BAdIs and configuration features that exist specifically for validity date proposal. You can implement both requirements limit the impact to your sales inquiries.

For the Auto set Validity Date to Enquiry Date plus 30 days, the best practice is to use flexible proposal of validity dates. This is standard configuration for proposing the valid to date for sales inquiries and quotations, based on calendar and offset rules. See Flexible Proposal of Validity Dates for more details.

Doing that will help you avoid changing a standard field through a BAdI, which is generally not supported for many standard fields in public cloud. See KBA 2733433

The following Blog: S/4HANA Q2C Sales Flexibility ‚Äì Determine Valid-to Date on Sales Inquiry and Sales Quotation via CPF also provides some insights.

In your CBC, search for Flexible Proposal of Validity Dates, create a rule for sales inquiry and restrict it to document type IN. Then set the offset rule to propose valid To = Enquiry Date plus 30 days, save and publish.

For you to Freeze Item Quantity after Validity Date has expire, you cannot make only one standard field read only while keeping others editable using classic GUI exits. However, you can block saving when a user tries to change quantity after the validity date. That is the usual public cloud pattern. You may consider using SD_SLS_CHECK_BEFORE_SAVE to validate the document and stop saving with an error message. In the BAdI logic check SalesDocumentType is equls to IN, only then run the validity check but do not run it for quotations or orders. See Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) for Sales Documents and KBA 3509178 for more details.

Here is a step guidance:

In the Custom Logic app,

create a new implementation for SD_SLS_CHECK_BEFORE_SAVE, add a filter condition for Sales Document Type = IN

You can implement logic as you need e.g.,

If today is greater than Valid To date, if quantity was changed, raise an error message and prevent save.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: RAP Draft Action EDIT Contract Violation: Failed not allowed cl_dsp_act_comn_exec_add_impl - Solved
entry.content:
Scenarion:  Custom RAP unmanaged behavior implementation with draft  - strict 

 draft action Edit with additional implementation; // additional implementation to provide virtual elements

In this Implementation of EDIT in the Z-behavior pool we checked if a delivery on this items exists, if so we raise a FAILED an a REPOTED Message 

Due to changes in the RAP Framework it looks like in the method EDIT with additional behavior, no FAILED is allowed anymore ( See comment below )
The HTTP-Error is the result of a dump:  ‚ÄúContract Violation: Failed not allowed‚Äù

The issue is a change in the RAP framework that is not compatible with our current implementation  Edit (with additional implementation).   During the EDIT operation, an error is detected because the tour has deliveries and the fields FAILED and REPORTED are filled.
However, RAP no longer allows this.

Cass cl_dsp_act_comn_exec_add_impl -> lcl_implementation -> Method lif_implementation~execute  are these new lines

 

These lines raise the short dump if there are failed messages: 

Solution

Business Requirement is to do checks right before an entity will be put into edit mode, such that an draft for an active item is created.  Using the provided RAP Feature Control is not an option, as:
1. We do not want to check that upfront for all items of the list 
2. We wand to do the check in that moment a user requests the draft.

We moved the check into the framework method LOCK, here we are allowed to raise FAILED an Reported. 

I am not 100% sure that this is the best place for "Draft Pre-Checks" but I did not find any better. 
Pre-Checks are not possible for EDIT actions. 


Thanks go out to @Sschlegel &  Bj√∂rn Schulz

entry.title: SAP instance fails to start when SNC (Kerberos) is enabled
entry.content:
Hello

 when we try to start SAP, it does not come up

 SAP instance fails to start when SNC (Kerberos) is enabled ‚Äì work processes abort during SNC initialization

System / Environment

SAP NetWeaver AS ABAP

OSS: Linux (RHEL 9)

Database: Oracle 19c

 SNC configured with Kerberos (MIT Kerberos, GSS-API)

 snc/gssapi_lib set to /usr/lib64/libgssapi_krb5.so

 snc/identity/as configured with machine principal

 

 The SAP ABAP instance fails to start when SNC is enabled.

The startup stops during work process initialization.

 When SNC parameters are disabled, the SAP system starts successfully.

 

 

 Observed Behavior

 SAP instance startup proceeds normally:

 DIspatcher starts

 Database connection succeeds

 Work processes are spawned

 During work process startup, SNC initialization begins.

 

The SNC library is successfully loaded:

 SncInit(): found snc/gssapi_lib=/usr/lib64/libgssapi_krb5.so

File "/usr/lib64/libgssapi_krb5.so" dynamically loaded as GSS-API v2 library.

 Immediately after loading the GSS-API library, the work process terminates with signal 6 (SIGABRT).

 

This behavior repeats for multiple work processes, causing the instance to fail startup

 

 SncInit(): Initializing Secure Network Communication (SNC)

SncInit(): found snc/gssapi_lib=/usr/lib64/libgssapi_krb5.so

File "/usr/lib64/libgssapi_krb5.so" dynamically loaded as GSS-API v2 library.

 

 /usr/lib64/libc.so.6(abort+0xd3)

...

/oracle/SID/19/lib/libclntsh.so.11.1(krb5int_key_register+0xb1)

/oracle/SID/19/lib/libclntsh.so.11.1(gss_krb5int_lib_init+0x29)

...

SncPDLInit()

SncInit()

ThSncInit()

ThInit()

abort()

 

 

 

System remains unavailable

 

Disabling SNC (snc/enable = 0) allows the system to start normally

 

 

 

 

Although SAP loads the configured GSS-API library successfully, the stack trace shows that Kerberos-related functions are being executed from the Oracle client library (libclntsh.so) at the time of the abort.

 

 

 QUESTIONS??

Why SAP work processes abort during SNC initialization after successfully loading the configured GSS-API library

 

How SAP expects SNC / Kerberos to behave when Oracle client libraries are present in the same process

 

Any known SAP Notes, restrictions, or supported configurations for:

 

SNC (Kerberos)

 

Oracle 19c client

 

Linux platforms

entry.title: Re: Best Practices for Structuring Business Object Migrat...
entry.content:
Dear @Halser_T,

Below is a pragmatic CALM-friendly way to structure data migration work for Public Cloud implementations. It is aligned with how SAP Cloud ALM is designed to be used SAP Activate template tasks + Requirements ->User Stories/Tasks + timeboxes/milestones + workstreams/tags

Question 1. How should migration objects be represented in SAP Cloud ALM?

Recommended modeling works well in real projects

Use a 3-layer structure:

1. Requirement (scope + quality gate)
Use Requirements to capture the what and how-good at a level that business/data owners can sign off:

    • object/domain scope (what‚Äôs in / what‚Äôs out)
    • data owners and sources
    • acceptance criteria (reconciliation rules, tolerances, completeness, audit evidence)
    • dependencies

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/applicationhelp/defining-requirements

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/applicationhelp/approving-requirements

2. User Story (deliverable outcome per object or object-group)
Use User Stories to represent the migration deliverable you want to manage end-to-end for example:

    • Business Partner master migrated and reconciled
    • Material master migrated and validated
    • Open AR items migrated and balanced
      User stories work well because Cloud ALM provides traceability views that roll up progress from sub-tasks/tests to show readiness

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/applicationhelp/user-story-traceability

3. (Sub-)Tasks (execution steps)
Put the operational steps into sub-tasks under the user story or project tasks where it‚Äôs cross-cutting. SAP Cloud ALM explicitly supports tasks derived from SAP Activate, manually defined project tasks and tasks generated from requirements

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/applicationhelp/task-management

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/applicationhelp/consuming-sap-activate-tasks

Use Project Tasks for work that is not a single object outcome:

  • migration tooling/setup (templates, connectivity, staging approach)
  • data governance, cleansing rules, naming conventions
  • cross-object cutover activities
  • runbook creation, hypercare checklist

Question 2. How to structure activities across target environments (D / Q / P)

Cloud ALM does not force a single right pattern but it does give you strong organizing points: phases/sprints/milestones (timeboxes), workstreams, tags, and a deployment plan/system landscape linkage

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/applicationhelp/project-planning-timeboxes

https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/implementation/sap-cloud-alm-implementation-expert-portal/project-management.html

A pattern that scales without exploding the backlog

Keep one User Story per migration object or object group and use:

  • Milestones for migration cycles (Mock 1, Mock 2, Dress Rehearsal, Cutover)
  • Tags or naming convention to mark environment D/Q/P
  • Sub-tasks for each environment only where it adds control

Example one object user story:
User Story: Business Partner migrated and reconciled
Sub-tasks (typical):

  • Mapping and transformation rules finalized (D)
  • Trial load + error remediation (D)
  • Mock Load #1 + reconciliation pack (Q)
  • Mock Load #2 / Dress rehearsal + timing evidence (Q)
  • Cutover load + reconciliation + business sign-off (P)

This keeps the object story stable, while execution iterates through environments and cycles

Use environment-separated groupings only if:

  • different teams own D vs Q vs P execution and
  • you need independent scheduling/ownership/visibility per environment

Question 3. Common templates / proven structuring approaches

Template A: Data domain -> objects -> cycles

  • Workstream: Data Migration and optionally sub-workstreams like Finance / Logistics / Sales
  • Requirement: Finance master data migrated
  • User Stories: G/L accounts, cost centers, profit centers, etc.
  • Milestones: Mock 1 / Mock 2 / Dress rehearsal / Cutover

Best when you have strong data domain ownership and want clear object accountability

Template B: Migration wave ->objects best for phased rollout / multiple countries

  • Requirement: Wave 1 data scope migrated (country/site/business unit scope)
  • User Stories: either (a) one per object in wave or (b) one per wave with object sub-tasks
  • Milestones: Wave go-live readiness gates, plus mock cycles inside the wave

Best when rollout governance is wave-driven

Template C: Cutover-cycle centric best when go-live risk is the driver

  • Create a Cutover-focused cluster of tasks in the Deploy phase:
    • final extraction
    • delta logic
    • production load steps
    • reconciliation & sign-off
    • go/no-go decision points
    • Cloud ALM‚Äôs timesbox concept (phases/milestones) supports exactly this style of cutover gating

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/applicationhelp/project-planning-timeboxes

Summary:

  • SAP Cloud ALM Project Management capabilities overview workstreams, tags, timeboxes, deployment plan/system groups are explicitly called out
  • SAP Cloud ALM help topics around Tasks/Requirements/timeboxes tasks from SAP Activate, project tasks, requirement-generated tasks, phases/sprints/milestones

More details below:

https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/implementation/sap-cloud-alm-implementation-expert-portal/project-management.html

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/applicationhelp/task-management

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/applicationhelp/project-planning-timeboxes

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/applicationhelp/approving-requirements

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/applicationhelp/consuming-sap-activate-tasks

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Learning SAP BTP with Terraform: What Should Come Next?
entry.content:
I‚Äôm relatively new to the SAP ecosystem. Recently, I started learning SAP BTP and paired it with Terraform to understand how modern SAP landscapes can be automated using Infrastructure as Code.

The journey wasn‚Äôt smooth. As a beginner in SAP, understanding how BTP accounts, subaccounts, entitlements, directories, and services fit together took time. Adding Terraform on top of that introduced a new set of challenges‚Äîprovider behavior, state management, and errors that weren‚Äôt always obvious from documentation.

Despite the ups and downs, this experience helped me build a solid foundation in both SAP BTP and Terraform. I now have a clearer understanding of how SAP BTP environments are structured and how they can be managed in a scalable, repeatable way.

Now I‚Äôm at a crossroads, and this is where I‚Äôd really like input from the community.

From a market and demand perspective, what should I focus on next?

  • Should I go deeper into SAP BTP services like CAP, Integration Suite, or Extension Suite?

  • Is there stronger demand for DevOps-style roles, focusing on CI/CD, automation, and governance in SAP BTP?

  • Would combining BTP + security, identity, and authorization be more valuable?

  • Or is expanding into multi-cloud Terraform and platform engineering the smarter move?

As someone early in the SAP journey, I want to invest time in skills that are not just interesting, but also relevant and in demand.

Looking forward to insights from people already working in the SAP BTP and cloud automation space.

entry.title: Re: Queries surrounding Form Language and Form Country/Re...
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, billing output (Form Language and Form Country/Region) is determined exclusively by customer‚Äërelated business partners such as the Bill‚Äëto Party and Payer.

In the scenario where the Bill‚Äëto Party is in one and the employee processing is in another country, the system will generate the invoice according to Bill‚Äëto Party's country and language rules. The employee processing's country has no influence on billing output, as internal employee roles are not considered in Output Management determination. 

You can also refer to the following SAP‚Äëprovided documentation:

  • Output Management for Sales and Billing Documents
    SAP Help Portal
  • Manage Billing Documents ‚Äì App Documentation
    SAP Help Portal
  • Invoice Forms & Country‚ÄëSpecific Templates
    SAP Help Portal
  • Country/Region‚ÄëSpecific Functions
    SAP Help Portal
  • Form Language issues explained by SAP experts
    SAP Community

entry.title: Nominations for learning program / initiative
entry.content:
I am looking for some ideas on how you manage nominations for learning programs or initiatives. 

We run cohorts of programs covering leadership or management etc. These are taken by employees who either put themselves forward, or who are nominated by their manager.

How do you, or how would you suggest, we manage this?

Currently an email is sent outside of the LMS to advise people of the initiative and we ask them to complete a MS Form. This is obviously very manual to manage, plus it doesn't connect to the HCM so doesn't have any employee data.

The record of the attendance is held within the LMS after the event.

Thanks, Sam

entry.title: Re: Add variant of main program to called program in a ba...
entry.content:
When the first executed program schedule the second program in a new background job, first create (or update)  a variant with the same name than the one received but for the new program, call explicitally the second programw with this variant

  • Get current executed variant SYST-SLSET
  • Create for next prrogam a new variant or or update anf already existsing one (FM RS_VARIANT_VALUE_SAVE, RS_CHANGE_CREATED_VARIANT, etc.)
  • Create the new job adding the step with explicit variant  name (FM JOB_SUBMIT parameyers REPORT and VARIANT)

If you pass the first background job id (JOBCOUNT, JOBNAME) to the second program, it could execute FM BP_JOB_DELETE to delete this job.

entry.title: Re: Black cracks appear when printing photos.
entry.content:
You are currently using a very old version of CR for VS SP 14 that is not supported on Windows 11.

Current version is SP 39 which you can get from here:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/crystalreports/3354091173.html?locale=en-US&ai=true

See this blog on upgrading your project:

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/upgrading-a-visual-studio-2008-gt-2022-net-project-with-the-latest-cr-net/ba-p/13469215

Also , use a real printer, CR doesn't work well with MS EasyPrint...

entry.title: Connecting SAP S/4HANA On-Prem Directly to Advanced Event Mesh using Cloud Connector - finally!
entry.content:
With Package Integration 1.4.0 (December 2025), the Advanced Event Mesh Adapter for SAP Integration Suite delivers several noteworthy updates.

One of these has been requested repeatedly by customers, partners, and SAP architects working in hybrid landscapes:
official support for on-premise connectivity via the SAP Cloud Connector.

In addition to this key enhancement, the release also includes other technical changes, such as an update to the default acknowledgment mode.

What‚Äôs New in Package Integration 1.4.0?

1Ô∏è‚É£On-Premise Connectivity via SAP Cloud Connector

The AEM Adapter can now officially route traffic to on-premise systems through the SAP Cloud Connector.

This enables a supported hybrid architecture where:

S/4HANA on-prem produces events
SAP AEM distributes them
Network security remains intact

Important note from the official release notes:

Avoid mixing proxy configurations within the same tenant to prevent unexpected routing behavior.

This is especially critical in complex hybrid tenants.

2Ô∏è‚É£Change of Default Acknowledgment Mode

The default acknowledgment mode has changed from:
      Automatic Immediate
to  Automatic On Exchange Complete

Technical implications:

  • Clearer delivery semantics

  • improved error handling
  • Better alignment with enterprise-grade integration scenarios

Package Integration 1.4.0 introduces multiple technical improvements.
The Cloud Connector support for the Advanced Event Mesh Adapter is a long-requested and architecturally significant enhancement.

It enables a clean, supported reference architecture to connect SAP S/4HANA on-premise directly to SAP Advanced Event Mesh, using SAP Cloud Connector as the secure hybrid backbone.

For SAP architects, this removes a major blocker when designing modern, event-driven hybrid landscapes.
